headline: How a Targeted New Jersey Grid Upgrade Will Impact FirstEnergy (FE) Investors
summary: Recently, FirstEnergy and subsidiary JCP&L began upgrading a key Monmouth County power corridor, adding a new high-voltage line and modernizing grid equipment as part of the US$28.00 billion Energize365 program running through 2029. This targeted reliability project, expected to benefit nearly 11,400 New Jersey customers, illustrates how FirstEnergy is turning its long-term grid modernization plan into specific, locally impactful investments. We’ll now explore how this Monmouth County grid...

headline: Surprise FirstEnergy Foundation "Gifts of the Season" Make Spirits Bright for Two Pennsylvania Nonprofits
summary: This holiday season, the FirstEnergy Foundation is sharing the spirit of giving by awarding $20,000 in "Gifts of the Season" grants to two nonprofit organizations making a positive impact in Pennsylvania communities served by FirstEnergy Pennsylvania. Altogether, the "Gifts of the Season" program will provide a total of $100,000 to eight nonprofits across five states in FirstEnergy's service area in 2025.

content.title: Surprise FirstEnergy Foundation "Gifts of the Season" Make Spirits Bright for Two Pennsylvania Nonprofits
content.summary: This holiday season, the FirstEnergy Foundation is sharing the spirit of giving by awarding $20,000 in "Gifts of the Season" grants to two nonprofit organizations making a positive impact in Pennsylvania communities served by FirstEnergy Pennsylvania. Altogether, the "Gifts of the Season" program will provide a total of $100,000 to eight nonprofits across five states in FirstEnergy's service area in 2025.

thumbnail.caption: This grant will help provide nutritious meals, safe shelter and essential resources to dozens of individuals and families facing hardship in the Troy, Pennsylvania, area. Each year, the organization delivers comprehensive housing support – along with rental and utility assistance – to ensure stability for 70 to 100 individuals.

headline: Surprise FirstEnergy Foundation "Gifts of the Season" Make Spirits Bright for Two Ohio Nonprofits
summary: This holiday season, the FirstEnergy Foundation is sharing the spirit of giving by awarding $20,000 in "Gifts of the Season" grants to two nonprofit organizations making a positive impact in Ohio communities served by FirstEnergy Corp. (NYSE: FE) electric companies. Altogether, the "Gifts of the Season" program will provide a total of $100,000 to eight nonprofits across five states in FirstEnergy's service area in 2025.

content.title: Surprise FirstEnergy Foundation "Gifts of the Season" Make Spirits Bright for Two Ohio Nonprofits
content.summary: This holiday season, the FirstEnergy Foundation is sharing the spirit of giving by awarding $20,000 in "Gifts of the Season" grants to two nonprofit organizations making a positive impact in Ohio communities served by FirstEnergy Corp. (NYSE: FE) electric companies. Altogether, the "Gifts of the Season" program will provide a total of $100,000 to eight nonprofits across five states in FirstEnergy's service area in 2025.

thumbnail.caption: The grant supports efforts to fight hunger and serve nutritious meals to vulnerable residents in Toledo. Located in Toledo’s central city, the MLK Kitchen feeds more than 200 people each day, including school children and the elderly. In 2024, they served 36,500 meals and distributed 3000 food boxes to the south Toledo community.

headline: Surprise FirstEnergy Foundation "Gifts of the Season" Grants Make Spirits Bright for West Virginia and Maryland Nonprofits
summary: This holiday season, the FirstEnergy Foundation is sharing the spirit of giving by awarding $40,000 in "Gifts of the Season" grants to two nonprofit organizations making a positive impact in West Virginia and Maryland communities served by FirstEnergy Corp. (NYSE: FE) electric companies. Altogether, the Gifts of the Season program will provide a total of $100,000 to eight nonprofits across five states in FirstEnergy's service area in 2025.

Altogether, the Gifts of the Season program will provide a total of $100,000 to eight nonprofits across five states in FirstEnergy's service area in 2025.
